private_information: I am interacting directly with objects and can perform primitive actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
I can sense some object identifiers and immediate relations when I act.
player.goal: Ensure that next object_9 object_7 becomes true according to available operations and perceived initial facts.

private_information: I have a partial global view of the initial facts and can track object roles across actions.
I specialize in mapping object identifiers and tracking which facts are statically given.
observer.goal: Support the establishment of next object_9 object_7 by reporting consistent mappings and candidate action sequences.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency. I detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post hoc penalties.
I will propose normalized preconditions and effects free of bookkeeping artifacts.
auditor.goal: Produce a corrected, temporally consistent action model that other agents can rely on to build a correct plan to reach next object_9 object_7.

private_information: I integrate analyses from other agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem tailored for the FastDownward planner.
I must keep agent actions distinct and name them to prevent accidental merging.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble a complete and consistent PDDL domain and problem that, when solved by FastDownward, achieves next object_9 object_7.

public_information: There is a set of objects named object_0 through object_9 and a few beyond as used by initial facts.
Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action refers to specific object argument positions as described by agents.
Action paltry requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects: adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1.
Action sip requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects: adds vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2.
Action clip requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects: adds vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched requires: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects: adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1.
Action memory requires: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects: adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1.
Action tightfisted requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects: adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1.

Initial static facts provided: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_6, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
The explicit planning goal is next object_9 object_7.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the acting agent that performs primitive operations in the object domain. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise structured analysis of how each available action maps arguments to preconditions and effects using the exact relation names in the environment. Identify which object positions are typically placeholders and propose candidate bindings drawn from the initial facts. Report any ambiguities or missing links that prevent reaching the goal.
analyze.prompt: Your name is player. Use the public information from the environment and your private knowledge about direct interaction. List for each action paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted: the required preconditions as sets of atomic facts, the add effects, and the delete effects. For each precondition or effect that mentions object_i placeholders, indicate possible concrete object bindings suggested by the initial facts and the rationale. If you must choose, prefer bindings that appear in initial facts like hand object_9 or texture object_5. Do not produce PDDL. Output a structured human readable report.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an observational agent with a partial global view. Do not emit PDDL. Your task is to reconcile object identifiers and report consistent name mappings across action schemas. Highlight initial facts that can seed bindings and any contradictions.
analyze.prompt: Your name is observer. Use the public information and the statement of initial facts. Produce a mapping of object placeholders to concrete candidates. Indicate which initial facts are static and which are likely transient. Point out if two roles seem to refer to the same physical object and suggest a canonical naming for planning. Provide a short prioritized list of candidate action sequences that seem promising to achieve next object_9 object_7, with brief justification.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Your job is to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, ephemeral counters, or post hoc penalties and to normalize the action model so the causal graph is clean. Do not emit PDDL. Provide corrected preconditions and effects and flag any cycles or irreversible deletions that would block planning.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Examine the public action descriptions and the initial facts. Identify any bookkeeping artifacts or fragile encodings. Propose a normalized set of preconditions and effects for each action that preserves intended behavior but avoids noncausal shortcuts. If an action relies on a token-like fact that is not grounded in the initial facts, suggest a replacement pattern or a connector action. Output a report with suggested corrections and a confidence level for each suggestion.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and you generate domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownward planner. Integrate the structured analyses from the other agents, resolve naming conflicts, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem that encode the normalized action model and the given initial facts and goal. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent name if appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure the resulting files are syntactically valid for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive three structured reports: one from the acting agent, one from the observer, and one from the auditor. Integrate their findings, apply the auditor corrections, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted at FastDownward. Use STRIPS style where possible. Include a typed objects section if useful. Name actions so that their provenance is clear. Include the initial facts exactly as given in the environment public information for the problem initial state and encode the goal next object_9 object_7. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. If any required information is missing, document the minimal assumption you made as a comment line inside the PDDL files.
